byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Maher Samaan from Beirut; Karam Shoumali from Gaziantep, Turkey; and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

abstract: Russian forces lead airstrikes on Syrian regions where Islamic State has no known presence, contrary to Russia’s announcement it would only target ISIS extremists; airstrike in Hamas Province on American-supported rebels raises worries Pres Bashar al-Assad is using Russian  military to quell all opposition and that moderates may begin to side with extremists.
lead_paragraph: The rebels were taken aback on Wednesday when Russia’s first airstrikes in Syria appeared to target areas where the Islamic State has no known presence.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Say Russia Is Targeting Them Rather Than ISIS
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Say Russia Is Targeting Them Rather Than ISIS

snippet: The rebels were taken aback on Wednesday when Russia’s first airstrikes in Syria appeared to target areas where the Islamic State has no known presence.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
